articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 11th in E (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 11th in E (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio refers to the 11th chord in the key of E, utilizing the C shape on the guitar fretboard. An arpeggio is the notes of a chord played individually rather than simultaneously. The 11th chord typically includes the root, third, fifth, seventh, and eleventh tones of the scale.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root (E)
- Third (G#)
- Fifth (B)
- Seventh (D#)
- Eleventh (A)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio, with its inclusion of the eleventh tone, adds a colorful and jazzy flavor to music. It is often used in jazz, fusion, and contemporary genres to create a sophisticated and harmonically rich sound. The 11th chord can provide a sense of tension and dissonance that can resolve in a satisfying manner, adding depth to compositions.

## Songs
1. Title: "So What"
   - Artist: Miles Davis
   - This iconic jazz piece features the 11th chord arpeggio prominently, adding to the modal jazz feel of the composition.

2. Title: "Teen Town"
   - Artist: Weather Report
   - In this fusion jazz piece, the 11th chord arpeggio is used extensively, showcasing its versatility and melodic possibilities.

3. Title: "Spain"
   - Artist: Chick Corea
   - This jazz fusion classic incorporates the 11th chord arpeggio in a dynamic and inventive manner, demonstrating its expressive potential in a musical context.
